executive_summary: The global e-cigarette market has been highly fragmented and dominated by independent companies; however, with the introduction of the trendy Juul device in 2015 and the boost in youth use, the E-cigarette Manufacturing industry has quickly become a rapidly growing battleground for tobacco giants to innovate industry products to capture revenue from former smokers and new customers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Regulators Attempt to Stamp Out Teen Vaping
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Amid a surge in teen use of alternative nicotine delivery systems and other industrial products, the FDA, the CDC and local and state governments have cracked down on e-cigarette products to prevent increased teen adoption and nicotine addiction rates.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Tobacco Companies Seek to Leverage E-Cigarette Manufacturing as Smokers Decline
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Rather than enable the competition to capture a greater market share, major tobacco companies have invested in or bought out production assets to provide nicotine to a growing population of consumers who use e-cigarette products over traditional tobacco products.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Continued Regulatory Pressure Will Slow Down Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Industry growth will slow down because of continued regulatory pressure from federal bodies like the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA), the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and other local and state government bodies.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Marketing and Research and Development Will Likely Remain Critical to Maintaining a Market Presence
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Since e-cigarette products are interchangeable, the main competitive factors among manufacturers are price and branding, so major manufacturers like Reynolds and Juul will continue to invest in marketing to boost sales.

industry_definition: The electronic cigarette (e-cigarette) manufacturing industry includes operators whose primary activity involves the manufacture of open and closed system alternative nicotine delivery devices, while the production of nicotine salts, liquids or refill cartridges for use in industry products is not included in this industry.

positive_impact_factors: high - increasing Barriers To Entry Level

threats: Price of semiconductor and electronic components

key_trends: The image shows a bar chart representing the Domestic Demand for the E-cigarette Manufacturing industry.
The Y-axis shows the Domestic Demand value in $ million, which is 5,517 for the given data point.
The X-axis is not visible, but it can be inferred that the chart represents the Domestic Demand projection or forecast for the industry.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Electronic cigarettes and open- and closed-system vaping devices are the primary products these specialized retail locations sell. Other products sold at these channels include hookahs, cigars and accessories for vaping devices, like batteries, chargers, electronic liquid or e-liquid pods. COVID-19 wreaked havoc on the segment, forcing vape shops to temporarily close in 2020 as they were deemed nonessential.

Online shopping is becoming more popular and acceptable. Many manufacturers have completely adapted to the virtual economy, as they now offer personalized websites that enable them to sell directly to consumers. Online stores can undercut prices because of lower operating costs, promotional discounts and other special items for consumers who purchase a set amount. COVID-19 led to an expansion in online orders as most people were quarantined to prevent contracting the virus.

products_and_services.product_description: Closed-system devices use individual cartridges or pods containing one of two general flavors, tobacco and menthol. Closed-system devices offer ease and convenience, as they come ready to vape once fitted together and charged. Users can customize closed-system devices based on personal nicotine strength preferences and choose from various colors offered by the manufacturer. This segment has risen as the simple mechanics, and the ease and convenience of only replacing one component have become highly attractive to consumers.

Electronic Cigarettes resemble traditional cigarettes, both in appearance and in use. E-cigarettes have higher nicotine content than their vaping counterparts, reminiscent of traditional cigarettes. These are one-piece units that must be disposed of when finished. Recent innovations have given rise to rechargeable e-cigarettes, with the tradeoff being significantly lower nicotine content. However, despite companies advertising these rechargeable devices as e-cigarettes, they fall under the closed system vaping devices classification.

Open-System Vaping Devices Require an Additional Step to Use. The open-system device features a tank that requires manual refilling with electronic liquid or e-liquid. It is specifically designed for this purpose and offers tobacco and menthol flavors. These devices come with larger batteries than their closed-system counterparts, allowing for increased usage before recharging. One main drawback is smokers experience a flavor ghosting effect when refilling the tank with a different flavor, which can be solved using a different tank. This market has declined as the additional step of manually inserting the e-liquid loses popularity compared to the ease and convenience of closed-system devices and e-cigarettes.

tier_1_suppliers: Industrial Machinery & Equipment Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Wire & Spring Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Supermarkets & Grocery Stores in the US
Gas Stations with Convenience Stores in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Although e-cigarette smokers purchase products despite disposable income levels because of the addictive nature of nicotine, they purchase premium products when they have more income. A boost in per capita disposable income benefits manufacturers since it makes consumers more willing to buy premium brands and try new products.

The percentage of smokers is the share of the adult population that smokes traditional tobacco products like cigarettes, pipes and cigars; this doesn't include users of e-cigarette products, but since an estimated one in five former smokers consumes e-cigarette products, it can be inferred that a drop in the population of smokers will likely incur a marginal boost in the population of consumers who use e-cigarette products, supporting industry demand.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Price of Semiconductor and Electronic Components
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The price of semiconductors and electronic components measures the price received by semiconductors and other electronic component manufacturers. As the price of these input components rises, e-cigarette products become more expensive to consumers.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Importers Benefit From a Rising US Dollar
international_trade_points.trade_description: An appreciating US dollar has made imported products more affordable domestically.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Low Wage Costs and Less Regulation Benefit Overseas Manufacturers
international_trade_points.trade_description: Foreign electronic cigarette producers can leverage low-wage labor costs and minimal governmental regulation to keep selling prices low. Imports have surged because of limited production in the United States and the concentration of electronics manufacturing in East Asia; this makes it more price effective for manufacturers to source inputs manufactured overseas.

international_trade_points.trade_title: A Stronger US Dollar Boosts Foreign Products
international_trade_points.trade_description: The value of e-cigarette exports has decreased because of an appreciating US dollar, which has caused US goods to be more expensive in foreign markets.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region is close to Canada, one of the industry's main export locations. Since these manufacturers rely heavily on electrical equipment, major companies in this industry locate in the region to access the market.
New York contains the most convenience stores of any state, attracting manufacturers to the area.
Higher disposable income levels in California support demand for e-cigarette products. The West's access to major transportation routes makes it easier to distribute e-cigarette products nationwide.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The FDA finalized a rule extending the Center for Tobacco Products (CTP) regulatory authority to cover all tobacco products, including e-cigarettes classified as electronic nicotine delivery systems (ENDS). The FDA also regulates the entire manufacturing process of e-cigarettes.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The CDC has passed legislation restricting e-cigarette sales to minors, retail e-cigarette licensure, smoke-free indoor air laws, including e-cigarettes and e-cigarette tax.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Center for Drug Evaluation and Research (CDER)
regulations_points.regulation_description: Some industry products are marketed as alternatives to traditional cigarettes to help people quit the addiction, otherwise known as therapeutic products regulated by the FDA Center for Drug Evaluation and Research (CDER) and require manufacturers to submit documents subject to approval and testing.
OSHA assures safe and healthful working conditions by setting and enforcing standards and providing training, outreach, education and assistance.

basis_points.basis_title: Competition among e-cigarette manufacturers is very high
basis_points.basis_description: Manufacturers primarily compete based on product price, quality and differentiation. Many leading tobacco manufacturers have competed to acquire small producers of niche products to expand market share.
Altria Group Inc., one of the world's largest producers of tobacco, cigarettes and related products, acquired a 35.0% stake in Juul Labs Inc. in 2018.

concentration_points.concentration_title: A low level of concentration indicates a fragmented market
concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry comprises a few large companies and many small manufacturers specializing in niche electronic cigarettes and vape devices with unique designs and tobacco and menthol flavor variations.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Small manufacturers cannot compete with the level of power possessed by large manufacturers
concentration_points.concentration_description: Large manufacturers benefit from long-term supplier contracts and strong relationships with major downstream wholesalers and retailers. Low-cost imports remain a significant challenge for the industry. As a result, large-scale operations that can lower per-unit costs benefit large manufacturers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases are the largest expense category
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs have increased over the past five years and are estimated to account for 37.0% of industry revenue in 2023. The industry relies on plastic, metal, semiconductor and electronic components purchases. High inflation in 2022 caused the prices of these materials to expand significantly.

Profit has increased over the past five years and is estimated to account for 9.2% of industry revenue in 2023. Profit has expanded because of the increased adoption of e-cigarette products by former and new smokers. Major manufacturers have aggressively cultivated brand images to separate themselves from the competition.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages have strengthened as a share of revenue
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wage costs have increased over the past five years and are estimated to account for 27.2% of industry revenue in 2023. Wages are high compared with other manufacturing industries, but within normal ranges for electronics manufacturing. Higher inflation has caused wages to rise slightly as a percentage of revenue in recent years.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: E-cigarette manufacturing is a labor-intensive industry
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: E-cigarette manufacturing is a labor-intensive industry. Despite this, manufacturers have continued to incorporate new technology and machinery into the manufacturing process, reducing the need for labor.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Government regulations constantly threaten the stability
volatility_points.volatility_description: Higher taxes enforced by state and federal authorities have significantly raised the retail price of electronic cigarettes. The federal minimum age for purchasing nicotine-containing products was raised to 21 in 2019, resulting in fewer new smokers and, in the long run, lower demand for e-cigarette products.

volatility_points.volatility_title: E-cigarettes' addictive nature benefits the industry
volatility_points.volatility_description: The addictive nature of nicotine drives many smokers to continue purchasing e-cigarette products despite the associated health risks and potential harm. E-cigarette sales often expand during economic recessions as low consumer confidence and higher stress levels prompt consumers to turn to the alleviating effects of nicotine.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Closed-system vaping devices represent the single-largest product
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Closed-system devices use individual cartridges or pods containing one of two general flavors, tobacco and menthol. Closed-system devices offer ease and convenience, as they come ready to vape once fitted together and charged. Users can customize closed-system devices based on personal nicotine strength preferences and choose from various colors.

E-cigarettes have higher nicotine content than their vaping counterparts, reminiscent of traditional cigarettes. These are one-piece units that must be disposed of when finished. Recent innovations have given rise to rechargeable e-cigarettes, with the tradeoff being significantly lower nicotine content.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Open-system vaping devices require an additional step
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The open-system device features a tank that requires manual refilling with electronic liquid or e-liquid. It offers tobacco and menthol flavors. These devices come with larger batteries than their closed-system counterparts, allowing for increased usage before recharging. One main drawback is smokers experience a flavor ghosting effect when refilling the tank with a different flavor.

FAQs.question: How does your company hedge against potential downturns in core-market activity?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturers that sell to a variety of markets will be less exposed to risk than those selling to one core market. The FDA banned the manufacture and sale of cartridge-based e-cigarette products amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

FAQs.question: How does your company's pricing structure compare to those of your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Companies with a subscription model like Juul Labs will have less revenue volatility than those relying on one-off sales to various end markets during economic downturns.

FAQs.question: How does your company hedge against price increase in specific input markets?
FAQs.answer: Companies that engage in long-term purchase contracts will exhibit lower input price volatility and wider profitability compared to those exposed to fluctuating raw material and shipping costs due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

FAQs.question: Is your company located in proximity to key end markets or key input suppliers?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturers located closer to end markets or suppliers will have a cost advantage over competitors due to lower shipping costs, exhibiting greater cost savings and profitability.

FAQs.question: In such a rapidly changing technological environment, has your company been able to reduce wage costs via the adoption of new technologies?
FAQs.answer: Industry wages comprise nearly one-fifth of the industry cost structure. Rapid demand swings could cause cost overruns if manufacturers need to quickly produce more products.

FAQs.question: In light of rapid swings in semi-conductor and other electronic component prices, has your company considered sought to bring production of components in house?
FAQs.answer: Vertical integration to produce necessary inputs can reduce purchase costs overall and variability in costs as a share of industry revenue.

FAQs.question: It is highly illegal to sell imperfect or mislabeled industry products. How does your company ensure that all federal qualifications and requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Operators committed to quality standards and complying with regulators may be seen as more trustworthy, potentially elevating their brand and sales performance.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all occupational health and safety requirements are adhered to?
FAQs.answer: Companies proactively managing workplace and product safety may be perceived favorably by consumers, likely exhibiting better sales performance.

FAQs.question: In a price-based competitive environment, how does your company differentiate itself from the competition to maintain profitability?
FAQs.answer: Cultivating a brand like Juul Labs allows companies to justify higher prices and sell branded products at a premium.

FAQs.question: Does your company exhibit any difficulty keeping operations current?
FAQs.answer: The COVID-19 outbreak stressed global supply chains, with some operators having difficulty securing transport and shipments. Long-term supply contracts for shipping can provide more stable sales.

FAQs.question: In such a fragmented market, how does your company control for varied manufacturing costs? How are you able to maintain your economies of scale?
FAQs.answer: Large operators have a competitive advantage due to lower per-unit costs resulting from economies of scale by dispersing costs over more units produced.

FAQs.question: How do you maintain quality of your products? Have you had any past issues with poor quality?
FAQs.answer: Producing high-quality electronic cigarettes is imperative due to health concerns and media coverage. Faulty products can lead to recalls and damage brand reputation.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure brand or product recognition, in an industry where products are essentially substitutable? Do you have future plans to continue differentiating your products?
FAQs.answer: Companies often spend on brand cultivation to protect sales, as industry products are differentiated by features like nicotine content, usability, and availability of refills.

FAQs.question: How does change in the population of smokers affect your sales? Do you closely track the percentage of smokers?
FAQs.answer: An estimated one in five former smokers consumes industry products. Declines in traditional tobacco smoking are beneficial to industry revenue.

FAQs.question: Despite difficult international trade conditions in the from of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) outbreak, unfavorable currency dynamics and deteriorating trade relations with China, how has your company kept up international sales? Do you track the value of the dollar?
FAQs.answer: Industry exports are not the most price-sensitive products, however, export trends will impact industry revenue growth.

FAQs.question: In what ways has your company been affected by heightened levels of regulation? Are you able to pass on the negative effects of regulation increases?
FAQs.answer: Regulatory efforts to curb teen and youth use of industry products have been strong, with the FDA eliminating the sale of flavored cartridges in recent years.
